project.teaser: "Each year, a substantial amount of food loss (FL) is generated at the primary production stage; FL have negative impacts on the society, contributing to food insecurity, depleting the environment, generating avoidable GHG emissions and creating pressure on land and water...
project.objective: "Each year, a substantial amount of food loss (FL) is generated at the primary production stage; FL have negative impacts on the society, contributing to food insecurity, depleting the environment, generating avoidable GHG emissions and creating pressure on land and water. Currently, key challenges hampering the reduction of FL are: regulatory challenges (e.g., exclusion of FL in the EU Commission Decision 2019/1597), technical challenges (e.g., lack of common measurement methodology, lack of cost-effective measurement tools), scientific challenges (e.g., lack of understanding of drivers) and social challenges (e.g., lack of skills of the different stakeholders involved). FOLOU is willing to contribute in overcoming these challenges, being the main objective of the project to set up the necessary mechanisms to: (i) measure and estimate (robust and harmonized methodology), (ii) monitor and report (national and EU FL registries), and (iii) assess the magnitude and impact of FL. Additionally, FOLOU will also work to assure the appropriate knowledge transfer and adoption of the project outcomes by the key targeted stakeholders: primary producers, retailers, consumers, policy makers and researchers. FOLOU will structure its activities in a comprehensive action plan revolving around four levers of change: 1#Understanding by working on collecting and curing FL available data, by working on understanding the drivers behind food losses and by assessing the impact of these losses; 2#Measuring by developing new cost-effective tools for the measurement/estimation of FL and a robust and harmonized methodology; 3#Training by providing tailored trainings to different stakeholders; 4#Adopting by preparing recommendations and creating a twinning programme. With a duration of 4 years, FOLOU gathers 16 multidisciplinary partners from 10 countries joining forces around a common challenge: Preventing and reducing the amount of food intended for human consumption that is eventually lost."
project.title: Bringing knowledge and consensus to prevent and reduce FOod LOss at the primary production stage. Understanding, measuring, training and adopting
project.keywords: Food Losses, Measurement and estimation methodology, Training, Sustainability

article.title: A knowledge-based reduction of food loss

result.title: Standard research protocol for the data collection
result.description: Protocol for data collection and assessment related to food loss drives and food loos accounting.

result.title: Communication package
result.description: This deliverable contains the Communication package that will maximise the impact of the project results.

result.title: Mapping of stakeholders and development of stakeholder engagement strategy
result.description: This deliverable contains a mapping of stakeholders and target audience, based on the identification of the stakeholders that have an interest and/or influence over the results of the project. An stakeholder engagement strategy will be included.

result.title: Project website
result.description: This deliverable will create the FOLOU's Project website

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - FOLOU (Bringing knowledge and consensus to prevent and reduce FOod LOss at the primary production stage. Understanding, measuring, training and adopting)
result.teaser: Every year a significant amount of food is lost during primary production. This has negative consequences for society, contributing to food insecurity, damaging the environment, causing greenhouse gas emissions, wasting water and degrading ecosystems and their...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Joint cooperation (clustering) plan with relevant other projects and initiatives
result.description: This deliverable will provide the Joint cooperation (clustering) plan with relevant other projects and initiatives

result.title: Practice Abstracts – batch 1
result.description: This deliverable contains the first batch of Practice abstracts (3) (End-user material produced in the form of a number of summaries for practitioners in the EIP common format).

result.title: Technical description of all the FOLOU Innovative solutions
result.description: Technical description of the 6 innovative tools to measure and estimate food losses including details on how the technology will be implemented, tested and validated (data gathering and monitoring plan). The 6 innovative tools are: - Embedded video cameras to forecast yield and measure losses (vegetables and pulses) - UAV high resolution data (fruits and vegetables) - Satellite & UAV measurement (root tubers & oil crops and grains) - Multi-spectral cameras (fish) - Blockchain for cold chain and its logistics (fish) - Big data for market demand prediction (all commodity groups)

result.title: Product Category Rules for the assessment of sustainability burdens of food losses.
result.description: Technical documents that will include a set of guidelines that determine what data should be gathered and how it will be evaluated when conducting the life cycle assessment (LCA) and other sustainability assessments (e.g., LCC and SLCA)

result.title: Plan for the dissemination and exploitation including communication activities (DEC)
result.description: This deliver contains the Plan for the Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication activities which will maximise the impact of the project results

result.title: Report on available data and information about food loss drivers
result.description: Report describing the data currently available on food losses in the different commodity groups

result.title: Project Data Management Plan (PDMP)
result.description: This deliverable contains the Project Data Management Plan, which includes a description of methodology and standards to be followed, what data sets are exploitable or made accessible for verification and re-use.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
